twitch_info.title: TINY bit of "WAVE the TAPPER" then viewer fangames? (suggest fangames and I will play them!)

message.body: i'm suggesting a game :) https://delicious-fruit.com/ratings/game_details.php?id=22742

you can lower your system sound but obs sound louder for us, that should work if its too loud
also in OBS you can adjust volume for each source. to increase it for stream, there's a setting called "gain" or something
it's definitely louder
i'd turn it down a bit, since mic is harder to understand
mic is more important than the game sound anyway
uh i'd definitely turn down game sound
yeah it's fine as is, don't worry about it
carnival i think
you probably just need to recapture

they are troll games bad audio balancing is intended

Yeah, celeste is awesome ‚ò∫Ô∏è

i just listen to the voices in my head
So a joke thing we'll do in VC when playing fighting games is we'll try and get someone started on some topic to distract them
"OBVIOUSLY"  ahahah don't just assume that about yourself and how people perceive you üòå
its easier being old though I've had a lot of times to sorta find a lot of friends over the years that share interests with me
idk how old you are though
as a 30-year-old, i get my interaction through hobbies
Yeah its true. I made a lot of my current friends through college or through people I meant through college. But the other half are online.
Making games is a hobby!!!
it helps to have hobbies that require interacting with other people
like for me, i have rock climbing, which necessitates being around others
most of my friends are still my highschool friends lol, I rarely talk with people I met in university
yeah there's a lot of jargon too
Gotta route~
What you're doing right now is fine. I have a friend who doesn't polay fighting games but she's a HEMA rapier fighter and we talk about the similarities a lot.
IRL. Fencing, but with real swords.
historic european martial arts = HEMA
Well you have armor and the swords are DULL at least
it's more physical and... bruising than liek fencing foils. but yeah its super cool!
Foils are a type of Olympic fencing sword but it's kinda like... I wanna say 'a car antenna' but I don't think people even have those anymore. They're like big thin flexible things
No, but that's a fair guess from what I said
Art, writing, roleplaying, map making... I have house plants I love. I collect hobbies üò≠
Kinda rotate them.
It's my own OCs but fanfic people are homies.
the kid and the guy
the swordfighting girl used to write fanfics
You're young so it's no pressure yet but my advice, if you're making fangames and stuff like... The more interests and other areas of knowledge you bring to things, the better you'll do them.
as a write and editor i could probably do it... but nah
You get more ways to connect with people to
wear many hats
if you're an introvert, irl hobbies are good cause habits are what helps overcome the homebody instinct
you should do something physical for many reasons yeah
(I say, as an introvert)
scribbles on my school papers is definitely a lost art media
The same is true for art in general though üòÖ I mean the embarrassment part is real. Totally valid way to feel but the only difference is overcoming that
WOW I AM INSULTED lol no it's somewhat true, but you can do pixel art AS art and take all those same advantages
Art is finding smart ways to cheat in general
YEAH ahahahaha
lol
Total accident
Photoshop
YEAH
Thats the first thing I thought too
It's a bit overkill but I use photoshop for a lot of stuff so using it for pixel art was natural

So I didn' think I could make game graphics at all though so I used to do it in this... old ancient program that forced super simple graphics. Then  I did IWBTG and I got a little more confident... and well Brave Earth isn't out yet but I was like "Oh I can just do pixel art now"
now, is it better than the chicken game :tf:
brave earth when
Honestly Lechurrajo I was like "I'm out of games to play and pictures I wanna make, maybe I should actually work on BEP again" today
It's been like 98% for like 4 years
lol
that 2% must be perfected
COVID lockdown basically fried my brain and burnout set in harcore
it kinda is though it's just the scale is bigger
I was pretty good for like 5+ years but then it got harder but I kept pushing and then covid and I was cooked.
will covid be featured in brave earth?
And then when this is all done, I'm going to do another big game like a fucking idiot
nice
ahahah, Brave Earth diverges timelines in 2016 so no
It's very NES Castlevania, but it's based on character and setting stuff I've had for years. So the game only goes into a little bit of it.
ahahah everyone has begged me for reference but I've always said no.
Yeah it has to stand on its own
after killing the final boss huge guy face destroys the background and you have to fight him
I hope so too but I mostly just hoping it finds an audience, even if its a small one
Nah. And I don't think I could outdo fangames at this point
Oh for sure!
I think the audience is actually bigger, but less dedicated?
that seems true to me
I think in terms of streamer support, the audience is much smaller.
not zero, but smaller.
YEAH. I think I'm a bit safer from that but it's like "can I make this financially viable"
barfy the lone survivor gets competition
gatepass design is a bit unhinged for a commercial game
yea thats the same issue i had with scribbledude that i underestimated, i did no advertising so noone knew about it besides the community
gatepass did get played by a few streamers, so there was some advertising. The main problem was that puzzle+platforming is a small audience
ye, back then when i was more productive
LOL yeha I'm gonna get some of that, but part of the design of the game is being true to the games of that late 80s era instead of just using the style like fashion.
